data.title: The Radio Drama Episode
data.meta_description: In our most ambitious live show, we turn journalism into a Broadway musical written by Lin-Manuel Miranda.
data.text:
Prologue

Carin Gilfry explains how she once accidentally locked herself in a hotel closet, and because today’s show is being broadcast from an opera house stage, Ira is able to take the story to a place he never usually can. (18 minutes)

Act Two: The Grandma Letters

Will Seymour reads letters he and his grandmother exchanged when he was in high school.

Act One: Mr. Boder Vanishes

In 1946, a man named David Boder started to investigate the Holocaust before it was known as the Holocaust.

Act One: The Sun Never Sets—On The Moosewood Restaurant

The story of two young people who, in their search to figure out who they were, pretended to be people they weren't.
